results.name: Denominator sequence of the n-th convergent of the continued fraction 1/(1 - 2/(2 - 2/(3 - 2/(4 - ...)))).
comment: The corresponding numerator sequence is A222470(n).

a(n) = Q(n,-2) with the denominator polynomials Q of A084950. All the given formulas follow from there. The limit of the continued fraction (-1/2)*(0 + K_{k=1..infty(-2/k)) = 1/(1 - 2/(2 - 2/(3 - 2/(4 - ...)))) is (+1/2)*sqrt(2)*BesselJ(1,2*sqrt(2))/BesselJ(0,2*sqrt(2)) = -1.43974932187... For more decimals see A222471.

For a combinatorial interpretation in terms of labeled Morse codes see a comment on A084950. Here each dash has label x = -2, and the dots have label j if they are at position j. Labels are multiplied and for a(n) all labeled codes on [1,2,...,n] have to be summed.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..445
formula: As a sum: a(n) = Sum_{m=0..floor(n/2)} a(n-m, m)*(-2)^m, n >= 0, with a(n,m) = (n!/m!)*binomial(n,m) = |A021009(n,m)| (Laguerre).
Explicit form: a(n) = Pi*(z/2)^(n+1)*(BesselY(0,z)*BesselJ(n+1,z) - BesselJ(0,z)*BesselY(n+1,z)) with z := 2*sqrt(2).
E.g.f.: Pi*c/(2*sqrt(1-z))*(BesselJ(1, c*sqrt(1-z))*BesselY(0, c) - BesselY(1, c*sqrt(1-z))*BesselJ(0, c)), with c = 2*sqrt(2).
example: Morse code: a(4) = -8 from the sum of all 5 labeled codes on [1,2,3,4], one with no dash, three with one dash and one with two dashes:  4! + (3*4 + 1*4 + 1*2)*(-2) + (-2)^2 = -8.
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 1, a[1] == 1, a[n] == n*a[n - 1] - 2 a[n - 2]}, a[n], {n, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 16 2017 *)
program: (PARI) m=30; v=concat([1,1], vector(m-2)); for(n=3, m, v[n]=n*v[n-1] -2*v[n-2]); v \\ _G. C. Greubel_, May 17 2018
(MAGMA) I:=[1, 1]; [n le 2 select I[n] else n*Self(n-1) - 2*Self(n-2): n in [1..30]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, May 17 2018
